NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a thing that blocks one's way 障碍物
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Her father's opposition remained their only obstacle.

NewWords.WordPhrase: so as to be safe if (sth.) happens 万一；假使
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Take a hat with you in case the sun is very hot.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. helpful; showing approval 有利的；赞同的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This region has a favourable climate for growing apples.

NewWords.WordPhrase: offer; last; stand fast 提出，提供；维持；坚持
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The forthcoming talks hold out the hope of real arms reductions.
e.g. He was late due to the very heavy traffic.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. decide that (sth. arranged in advance) will not happen 取消
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The match had to be cancelled because of bad weather.
e.g. They have called off their trip to Tibet.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. not present; missing 缺席的；没有的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He was absent from the meeting.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. (of a wind, etc.) blowing strongly; not easily bent, changed in shape, etc.（风等）强烈的；硬的；僵直的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He walk forward difficultly because of the stiff wind.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a thing that makes a situation more complex or difficult 复杂情况；（新出现的）困难；障碍
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Another complication was the excess of imports over exports.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. endure without giving in; resist 承受；抵挡
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This building is able to withstand destruction forces of nature.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. worry; be relevant to; affect 使担心；涉及；影响   concerned a. worried; troubled 担心的；忧虑的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We're rather concerned about father's health.
e.g. We received no notification prior to today's date.

NewWords.WordPhrase: prevent from moving 把…困住; 使不能行动
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He was pinned down by his attackers.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. being the cause of; legally or morally obliged; reliable and sensible 作为原由的； 应承担责任的；负责可靠的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The bus driver is responsible for the passengers safety.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. fight for; struggle to win or keep 争夺  n.  争夺；竞争；比赛
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. How many people are contesting the seat on the council?

NewWords.WordPhrase: bring good results; succeed 取得好结果；成功
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His hard work paid off when he got a promotion.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. talk about in a manner showing too much pride and satisfaction 吹嘘
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The boy boasted that his bicycle was of the best quality of all the bicycles in the school.
